claim: The isolate was identified by PHOL to be C. inhibens with homology of 99% using 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis (Fig. 1a-d), though this information was only available after the patient was discharged home.
title: Fig. 1.
caption: Carnobacterium inhibens isolated after incubation at 37 °C for 18 h. a, b 1–2 mm diameter, grey-colored, round, alpha-hemolytic colonies on 5% sheep blood agar. c Grey-colored, flat colonies surrounded by greenish discoloration around the colonies on chocolate agar. d Gram staining of blood culture isolate of C. inhibens depicting Gram-positive, asporogenous, lactobacillus-like rods, 100x
